meanings.definition: A written work dealing formally and systematically with a subject.
meanings.sent1: The library had many treatises on ancient history.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often refer to treatises when researching specific topics.
meanings.sent3: The treatises on gardening made the plants seem like talkative friends.
meanings.sent4: Her treatises on love were like maps guiding the heart through unknown territories.
meanings.sent5: The treatises on astronomy painted the stars in words for all to understand.

meanings.definition: A formal and systematic exposition in writing of the principles of a subject.
meanings.sent1: Students found the treatises on mathematics very helpful for understanding complex concepts.
meanings.sent2: The treatises on economics explained the theories in a clear and organized manner.
meanings.sent3: The treatises on cooking turned recipes into scientific experiments.
meanings.sent4: His treatises on leadership were like blueprints for success in business.
meanings.sent5: The treatises on psychology delved deep into the human mind's mysteries.
